meaningMnemonic: If someone is <radical>sick</radical> feed them <radical>charcoal</radical> to <kanji>heal</kanji> them. Okay, so maybe you shouldn't feed it directly to them, but charcoal has amazing water filtration powers. So put charcoal in their water and the water will heal them right up.
readingMnemonic: You aren't the only one that needs to be <kanji>heal</kanji>ed, so you take your <reading>row</reading> (りょう) boat out onto the lake where your town gets its drinking water and you dump a bunch of charcoal into it! Now everyone will be healed when they drink.
